intro: Ardisia labordei, commonly known as the Hawaiian ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, red berries. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. It has a compact shrub form with multiple stems and is often found in lowland to montane habitats. Ardisia labordei plays a role in the ecological balance of its native environment, providing food for various bird species.
